Package anydev

Class Mass

java.lang.Object
anydev.Mass
public final class Mass extends Object
Define a specific mass of anything NOTE: Internally, the actual value is always stored in TON. It is converted when exposing it as needed NOTE: Class is designed to be immutable. Do not allow setters, return deep-copies if aiming to change values... NOTE: class is based on double precision. You may encounter tiny rounding errors
Since:
2025_06_20

    • create

      public static Mass.Mass_Unit create(double value)
      Start creating a new Mass
      Parameters:
      value - how much mass should be in here

    • create

      public static Mass.Mass_Unit create()
      Start creating a new empty mass (internal qty=0)

    • getCopy

      public Mass getCopy()
      Create a deep copy of this mass
      Returns:
      a deep copy of this mass, retaining all characteristics

    • getMass

      public double getMass(Mass.Unit unit)
      Returns:
      how much mass (in getUnit()s). Will be >=0.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      NOTE: Does not account for floating-point uncertainty for tiny masses. Only checks if itis *exactly* 0
      Returns:
      true if this mass contains nothing, i.e. mass==0.

    • add

      public Mass add(Mass toAdd)
      Adds given mass to this mass. Returns new (deep-copy) mass with sum of both masses Accounts for units automatically.
      Parameters:
      toAdd - mass to be added to this mass
      Returns:
      new (deep-copy) mass that is the sum of this mass plus toAdd

    • subtract

      public Mass subtract(Mass toSubtract)
      Subtracts given mass from this mass. Returns new (deep-copy) mass with new reduced mass Accounts for units automatically.
      Parameters:
      toSubtract - mass to be removed from this mass. Must be <= this mass
      Returns:
      new (deep-copy) mass that is oldMass-toSubtract
      Throws:
      ERROR - if toSubtract>thisMass

    • getAsVolume

      public Volume getAsVolume(Density withDensity)
      Convert this mass into a volume
      Parameters:
      withDensity - density of this mass
      Returns:
      a (new) volume equal to this mass at given density

    • isHeavier

      public boolean isHeavier(Mass compareTo)
      Compare this Mass to given compareTo Mass to find out if it has a higher mass Accounts for units automatically
      Parameters:
      compareTo - which mass to compare to
      Returns:
      true if this Mass has bigger (or equal!) mass to given compareTo mass. False if compareTo is heavier
